item.title: Teleport Problem
item.dc:creator: @thereaper93 thereaper93
item.description:
@thereaper93 wrote:

Ok as I am a beginner coder I’m not sure how much help I will be but I will give it a shot.
This following code works in Sinequity! base.

if (command.startsWith(“train”)) {

triggerTele(2524, 4774, 0);

}

As you may have noticed, there are spaces in the tele coordinates, you could also try just changing that in your commands.

Another code, this one more I know works in a 317 delta. Notice how it also has the tele coordinates spaced.

if(command.startsWith(“home”)){
sM(“Welcome home!”);
triggerTele(2324, 3675, 0);
}

This one has the send message in it, in a different context than yours.

By looking at these I would believe that your problem is not having spaces in the coordinates.
Either way here are a couple things you could try.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport Problem
item.dc:creator: @Kosmos Kosmos
item.description:
@Kosmos wrote:

Hey guys im in the process of building a server and i know how to add teleport commands usually as ive done it a lot but ive added the it indo commands , compiled, re ran the server and i type the command, i.e : ::home , and nothing happens?? can someone help me or explain why this is happening. Here is the code for the teleport i have use: none of them work and there no errors while compiling?

		if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("train") && c.playerRights >= 0) {
			c.getPA().movePlayer(2524,4774,0);
			c.sendMessage("@dbl@Welcome To The Training Area.");
			}
		}		
		if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("home") && c.playerRights >= 0) {             
			c.getPA().movePlayer(3087,3495,0);
			c.sendMessage("@dbl@You have teleported home");
			}
		}

someone please help

Read full topic
